channel.title: Akemi's Anime World Site Updates
channel.description: New reviews, other additions, and site news for Akemi's Anime World.

item.title: Mar. 15, 2013
item.description: In honor of the late Naya Goro, unforgettable voice actor of Zenigata, a review of the not-so-good classic Lupin III: The Mystery of Mamo.

item.title: Oct. 7, 2012
item.description: New review from Marc of the quality sequel Spice and Wolf II.

item.title: Sep. 27, 2012
item.description: Some classic reviews from Chainclaw, of the much-worse-than-you'd-think, forgotten DS RPG InuYasha: Secret of the Divine Jewel, and the not-as-bad-as-you'd-think magical girl OVA Wedding Peach DX (which was accidentally stuck in the queue for the last few months).

item.title: Sep. 14, 2012
item.description: Chainclaw reviews the not-as-bad-as-you'd-think gun-girl show Upotte!!.

item.title: Jul. 10, 2012
item.description: After months of dormancy while other projects progressed quietly, a collection of new reviews, most of which have been sitting in the queue since last year: the lost '80s classic Transformers: The Headmasters from Chainclaw, old-school yaoi one-shot Fake from Matt, and from Marc the shoddy yuri knockoff Strawberry Panic and one of his personal favorites Spice and Wolf. On a different note, also from Chainclaw, a review of the older PS2 game InuYasha: The Secret of the Cursed Mask.

item.title: Mar. 31, 2012
item.description: Today Chainclaw reviews the cosplay-themed fanservice fest Cosplay Complex.

item.title: Feb. 10, 2012
item.description: Two fanservice-drenched but still pretty good good parodies reviewed today: Godannar by Marc and G-On Riders by Chainclaw.

item.title: Jan. 19, 2012
item.description: Getting back into the swing of things after a brief SOPA/PIPA protest blackout with a review of the not at all good magical girl oldie Wedding Peach by Chainclaw, and the much better wacky comedy oldie Ghost Sweeper Mikami by Legion.

item.title: Oct. 28, 2011
item.description: Lots of new reviews: The flashy but somewhat scattered Xam'd and the over-the-top action favorite Read or Die from Matt, and not one, not two, but all four InuYasha movies from Chainclaw: Affections Touching Across Time, The Castle Beyond the Looking Glass, Swords of an Honorable Ruler, and Fire on the Mystic Island.

item.title: Oct. 03, 2011
item.description: New reviews of a pair of sports shows--one good and the second bad--from Chainclaw: Taisho Baseball Girls and Bamboo Blade, plus Matt's take on the romantic comedy Nodame Cantabile.

item.title: Sept. 08, 2011
item.description: New review of the generally-marvelous Durarara!! (exclamation points included) by Marc.

item.title: Sept. 01, 2011
item.description: New (and unkind) review from Chainclaw of Fushigi YÃ»gi: Eikoden.

item.title: Aug. 20, 2011
item.description: New reviews today of the prequel Ga-Rei-Zero from Matt and the sequel Mermaid Melody Pichi Pichi Pitch Pure from Chainclaw. Our old-school discussion forums also just got a major upgrade, makeover, and anti-spam workout in an attempt at revitalization--if you're up for such things sign up and speak your mind.

item.title: Jul. 11, 2011
item.description: Four new reviews today: The American football series Eyeshield 21, which Chainclaw loved, the weird Dead Leaves, which Matt liked, the dating-sim-based remake Kanon, which Matt also liked, and the abysmal and embarrassing harem short Eiken, which Marc hated.

item.title: Jun. 29, 2011
item.description: A review of the forgotten Rumiko Takahashi short Fire Tripper from Chainclaw, lots more in the pipeline.

item.title: Jun. 05, 2011
item.description: After a long delay due to family issues, we begin unloading the backlog of material with a review of the cerebral biopic Spring and Chaos from Matt and, from Chainclaw, the topnotch Lupin III film Crisis in Tokyo.

item.title: Apr. 06, 2011
item.description: Three more reviews from the still-deep queue: Chainclaw on the mediocre magical girl show Mermaid Melody Pichi Pichi Pitch, Matt (aka Legion) on the lame sequel Kite: Liberator, and Marc on the insane not-quite-sequel Puni Puni Poemy.

item.title: Mar. 22, 2011
item.description: A review of the short but good indie action show Catblue Dynamite, and the short but not so good mecha parodies ARIEL and Deluxe ARIEL; Chainclaw also weighs in on both ARIEL series, and thought even less of them. More from Chainclaw in the pipeline.

item.title: Feb. 25, 2011
item.description: The first in a series of reviews of yuri series from Marc, the somewhat bland Kashimashi Girl Meets Girl, and from Chainclaw a review of the second Fushigi YÃ»gi OVA series, a solid sequel.

item.title: Jan. 31, 2011
item.description: A couple of reviews of old-school sci-fi: the abbreviated war story Big Wars, by Chainclaw, and the Streamline dub of 8 Man After, by Marc, plus a second opinion of 8 Man After from Damian.

item.title: Jan. 23, 2011
item.description: Several new reviews: The new, but not very good, Devil May Cry, by Legion, the older, relatively good Orphen: Revenge, by Chainclaw (who also added a very different, and very negative, opinion of the first season ), and a long review of the very short Dominion sequel Tank S.W.A.T. 01, by Marc. We've also edited the reviews and updated the trivia of over fifty additional anime during that quiet spell, and there are a half-dozen more new reviews coming shortly.

item.title: Dec. 7, 2010
item.description: New review by Chainclaw of the older classic remake Casshan: Robot Hunter and from Legion on the newer, thoroughly-unusal Ghost Hound. More new reviews are on deck for later.

item.title: Nov. 15, 2010
item.description:
Three new reviews for the day, by three different people: Chainclaw raves about another Lupin III film, Dead or Alive, Marc has some unexpectedly kind things to say about the Kanokon OVAs, and Legion was disappointed by Air.

Yes, you read that right--Matt "Legion" McClellan, one of our first additional reviewers, is back after a six-year hiatus. Welcome back! More reviews from all three of the above are on deck.

item.title: Oct. 30, 2010
item.description:
Updates are still being held back as a result of family health issues, but we're trying to catch up. Today we have a lengthy analysis of the unexpectedly good Toradora! by Marc and a review of the classic Lupin III: The Fuma Conspiracy by Chainclaw.

We also have a very belated announcement (held up by those same health issues) of our Make Us Look Bad FIWAJC! winners: Chris Hooper, for finding the "best" mistake (a millenium-old error repeated in our Trigun review), Jon Perry, for finding a whopping 53 errors (among which was misspelling the word "embarrassing" in the definition of the word embarrassing, runner-up best mistake), and Lizzie Coster, who got randomly selected among remaining entries by the gremlins in the computer. Congratulations!

...sort of. See, the delay is in part because we haven't yet been able to get ahold of two of them (I have a feeling it's because of all the "You've won a million dollars and a trip to the moon!" spam). So, if you are Lizzie Coster or Jon Perry (or know one of them), please get ahold of us so you can tell us what prize you want and where to send it!

Finally, happy Halloween!

item.title: Oct. 3, 2010
item.description: Some personal health issues have held up reviews for a while, but we'll start clearing the backlog with reviews of all three Crusher Joe outings, by Chainclaw: The Movie, The Ice Prison, and The Ultimate Weapon: ASH.

item.title: Sept. 10, 2010
item.description: Today we welcome the first of two new official reviewers, longtime contributor and fantasy expert Corey "Chainclaw" Suydam, with three new reviews and more to follow: Azumanga Daioh, Lupin III: Missed By A Dollar, and Rurouni Kenshin: The Motion Picture, plus a second opinion on Rune Soldier Louie.

item.title: Aug. 24, 2010
item.description: New review of the almost-great Persona: Trinity Soul.

item.title: Jul. 20, 2010
item.description: New review of the fantastic mixed-genre show Baccano!

item.title: Jul. 11, 2010
item.description: Unnecessarily long review of the abominable Rescue Me: Mave-Chan.

item.title: Jul. 08, 2010
item.description: Resuming our slog through a considerable backlog of reader reviews with M Man's take on the classic Nadia: Secret of Blue Water.

item.title: Jul. 04, 2010
item.description: A Happy Independence Day to those in the USA, and a new review of the arty comedy Sayonara Zetsubou Sensei.

item.title: Jun. 27, 2010
item.description: New review for the weekend, the disturbingly funny Magical Witch Punie-chan.

item.title: Jun. 22, 2010
item.description: Our all-new, drastically improved look goes live right now. A blog post with details will follow shortly, and our apologies for all the glitches as we make sure everything is working. Highlights of the re-launch include all-new company profiles, some AAW History, hundreds of small tweaks, dozens of updated reviews, a new review of the sleazy Kanokon and a mostly-new review of the wonderful Whisper of the Heart. More additions to be announced later.

item.title: Feb. 11, 2010
item.description: In advance of next month's DVD/Blu-ray release, a hefty review of Miyazaki's latest, Ponyo.

item.title: Nov. 01, 2009
item.description: Two double reviews: Lengthy discussions of the spectacular Code Geass and its mostly-disappointing sequel R2, plus the disturbing Bludgeoning Angel Dokuro-chan and its not-so-disappointing sequel. Also another review from reader Chainclaw, of Steamboy.

item.title: Jun. 09, 2009
item.description: New reader review from deep in the backlog of Ninja Scroll: The Series by longtime contributor Chainclaw, the first of several.

item.title: Jun. 01, 2009
item.description: New official reviews of the fun Allison and Lillia, season 1 and season 2, and the hilarious Kyouran Kazoku Nikki.

item.title: Apr. 04, 2009
item.description: New official review of Dennou Coil.

item.title: Mar. 29, 2009
item.description: New official review of Popotan and a reader review of Batman: Gotham Knight by longtime contributor Wolfwood.

item.title: Mar. 21, 2009
item.description: New official review of Shadow Star Narutaru and a reader review of Eureka Seven by Jared Prewitt. More of both to follow.

item.title: Feb. 22, 2009
item.description:
Though it's been up for a few days already, we're going to give the blog thing a shot, with commentary on what we're currently watching. This isn't in place of any reviews; rather, it's making my internal notes public in the hopes some might find them interesting, plus a few side bits of commentary that didn't fit anywhere else on the site. We're also going to try and add bits of Akemi's commentary on interesting goings on in Japan, if her schedule permits. Also, since the blog is more about process than product, it makes more sense to post details with what's going on at the site there rather than here; the news feed will, thus, return to what it was in the old days, more of a brief list of changes. The blog is linked from the home page or available at blog.animeworld.com; feel free to comment if you love or hate the idea--it's a work in progress.

And on that note, two new reviews today, both of rather goofy comedies: The crazy, funny Akahori Gedou Hour Rabuge and the weak Itsudatte My Santa. Also fixed the review search, which was somewhat broken.

item.title: Jan. 01, 2009
item.description: Welcome to 2009: today we celebrate AAW's tenth birthday. '08 was a rather quiet year here, and we did hope to have something a little more exciting ready for an anniversary announcement, but it's not ready yet, so oh well. Instead, just a thank you to all of the 10 million people who've visited AAW over the past decade, and a wish of a good 2009 to all.

item.title: Aug 16, 2008
item.description:
New reviews! First another unexpectedly good Geneon comedy, Dokkoida?!. Second the obscure action-western Early Reins.

And third, our first two reviews to include Blu-ray info: Yukikaze and SOS Tokyo Metro Explorers: The Next. We figured that, since the silly next-gen format wars finally ended it was time to get on the boat, in particular reviews of the ridiculously expensive not-quite-imports from Bandai's Honneamise label, like these two, to help you decide if it's really worth quadruple the price of the DVD for a high def version.

More stuff and reader reviews to follow in the near future.

item.title: June 05, 2008
item.description:
New review today of one of the funniest things the editorial "we" have seen recently, Daphne in the Brilliant Blue. The review actually isn't quite done, but it turns out RightStuf is running a clearance sale on a bunch of Geneon DVDs, among which is Daphne for a paltry $5 a disc, so we wanted to spread the word while the gettin's cheap.

Also at work on plenty of other stuff, but we'll wait until it's more finished to talk it up.

item.title: Jan. 01, 2008
item.description: Happy new year! Still alive and kicking. Akemi is currently in Japan and not blogging from there.

item.title: Mar. 19, 2007
item.description:
We actually aren't exactly ready to go live with a couple of new features, but on the theory that the best sort of debugging is the sort that happens in the real world, we're firing it up anyway for testing purposes--please drop us a note if you notice problems!

Aside from the (hopefully obvious) total re-design of the front door (plus the addition of an RSS feed for those who like that sort of thing), we're officially adding (although it's actually been there for a while) a news feed (with up-to-the-hour anime news from ANN) for those who follow that sort of thing, as well as the re-launch of our deal tips feature, also here on the front page.

Further, we're going to give the blog thing a shot with Akemi's sort-of-blog What's Happenin' in Japan, some random news and pop culture commentary from the woman herself. Also, just in case that wasn't enough, the first couple of Japanese lessons now have audio samples to help with your pronunciation, with more to come.

item.title: Mar. 10, 2007
item.description:
Bit of a gap in there because of copius medical tests, but we've been up to several things:

First, congratulations to our February 1st FSWAJC winner, Li-Mei, and our February 15th winner, Alice. Bit of a delay in selecting the winner for the first of March, but we'll catch up momentarily. Remember, you can't win if you don't enter.

Second, as is rather obvious (I hope), we've been adjusting and improving the site's layout. On the positive side, we've made the look more consistent from section to section by getting rid of those funky righthand index boxes and combining them with the lefthand menu. On the potentially negative side, there's a stripe over to the right reserved for in-site plugs, shopping, and ads. The US medical system is extraordinarily expensive, so I'm hoping this'll help my own bottom line a bit, but fear not--I hate annoying, useless ads as much as anybody, so I'm going to be doing my darnedest to put direct-to-product shopping links that are relevant to the reviews over there so it might actually help you out. This'll take a while since I'm handpicking them, but you can get an idea of how it'll work if you pop your head into the more reviews section.

Third, due to popular request (and despite the "anime" in the site's title), we're going to try adding some manga reviews--most anime is based on manga, after all. Being that I'm only an occasional manga reader, however, it remains to be seen if some of the folks who expressed interest in writing manga reviews will follow through. If you have any suggestions on format or information the reviews should include, by all means let us know.

That's all for right now, but since these major format changes often cause some funkiness, if anything looks funny, try hitting reload. If that doesn't do it, let us know so we can fix it. And stay tuned for a few more new things still in the works.

item.title: Jan. 18, 2007
item.description: Congratulations to Brian, the very first FSWAJC winner--your Castle of Cagliostro DVD is on the way. The next question is up and there's still a whole bucket o' prizes to win, so go for it if you're inclined.

item.title: Jan. 15, 2007
item.description: A wee bit of a delay in actually getting any new material up in the new year, but the first winner in the trivia contest will soon be selected, and the question for the rest of the month is up and ready for you to try your hand at.

item.title: Jan. 02, 2007
item.description: Welcome to 2007. Health is still keeping us behind in the proper updates, but how about a random little treat: We're trying our hand at a cheesy little contest. We'll see how it goes.
